Package entity

Class Pickup

java.lang.Object
entity.Entity
entity.Pickup
All Implemented Interfaces:
CollisionElement, EngineComponent
Direct Known Subclasses:
ApplePickup
public abstract class Pickup
extends Entity
The Pickup class handles some of the backend core functionality of on-screen Pickups

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    protected int height
    The height of the Pickup
    protected int spawnDeadzone
    The dead-zone of the game (in pixels), used to stop Pickup instances from being spawned too close to the edge of the screen.
    protected boolean toBeDestroyed
    Represents if the Pickup is marked to be destroyed by the EntityController
    protected int width
    The width of the Pickup
    protected int x
    The position of the Pickup on the X-axis
    protected int y
    The position of the Pickup on the Y-axis

    Fields inherited from class entity.Entity

    gameInstance

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Pickup​(SnakeGame game)
    Constructs the Pickup with default position of x,y(1,1)
    Pickup​(SnakeGame game, int pX, int pY)
    Constructs a Pickup instance with the information provided, and calls the init callback

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void applyEffect​(Entity e)
    Applies the effect by destroying the Pickup via the EntityController attached to the gameInstance
    boolean checkSpawnPoint​(int x, int y)
    Tests that the given co-ordinates are within the eligible zone of the game (as in not outside of the deadzone)
    boolean collidedWithGameBoundary​(java.awt.Rectangle collisionBox)

      public Pickup​(SnakeGame game, int pX, int pY)
      Constructs a Pickup instance with the information provided, and calls the init callback
      Parameters:
      game - The SnakeGame instance this Pickup belongs too
      pX - The X position of the Pickup
      pY - The Y position of the Pickup

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init()
      Called when the Pickup is ready for initialisation

    • applyEffect

      public void applyEffect​(Entity e)
      Applies the effect by destroying the Pickup via the EntityController attached to the gameInstance
      Parameters:
      e - The entity the effect is being applied to

    • destroy

      public void destroy()
      Destroy the Pickup by scheduling it's removal via the EntityController

    • setX

      public Pickup setX​(int dX)
      Sets the X position of the pickup
      Parameters:
      dX - The x position
      Returns:
      The Pickup to enable method chaining

      public java.awt.Rectangle getBounds()
      Creates a Rectangle which represents the boundary of the Pickup
      Returns:
      The boundary of the pickup

    • isCollisionBoxIntersecting

      public java.awt.Rectangle isCollisionBoxIntersecting​(java.awt.Rectangle collision, CollisionElement source)
      Checks to see if the collision box provided intersects this pickups boundary
      Parameters:
      collision - The collision box to test
      source - The source of the collision
      Returns:
      Returns true if the collision box is proven to intersect, false otherwise

    • collidedWithGameBoundary

      public boolean collidedWithGameBoundary​(java.awt.Rectangle collisionBox)
      Called when the pickup has collided with the border of the game; no action required
      Parameters:
      collisionBox - The collision box of the pickup that is said to be colliding with the boundary
      Returns:
      Returns false as the collision is being ignored

    • checkSpawnPoint

      public boolean checkSpawnPoint​(int x, int y)
      Tests that the given co-ordinates are within the eligible zone of the game (as in not outside of the deadzone)
      Parameters:
      x - The x co-ordinate to be tested
      y - The y co-ordinate to be tested
      Returns:
      Returns true if position is valid

    • update

      public void update​(double dt)
      Called for each tick of the game; no action is required for this entity
      Parameters:
      dt - Amount of time passed since last update
